question_title: Will the community prediction be higher than 46.00% on 2026-02-12 for the Metaculus question "Will an AI-created song chart in the top 20 of the Billboard Hot 100 before 2027?"?
summary: This is a meta-prediction asking whether the Metaculus community prediction will be above 46.00% on Feb 12. The current CP appears to be ~50% (per API), already 4 percentage points above the threshold. With 866 forecasters creating a stable base and only ~9 days remaining, a drop back to 46% or below is unlikely without major news. Key context: AI songs have charted on niche Billboard charts but NOT the Hot 100 (Billboard blocked "I Run" in Nov 2025). Manifold prices the underlying question at ~36%, suggesting possible Metaculus overestimation, but for meta-predictions what matters is forecaster behavior, not truth. The recent trend has been upward (46%→50% in 2 days), and large forecaster bases are sticky. The main risk is negative news about AI music or Billboard policy that causes a rapid sentiment shift.

factors.description: Current CP already at 50%, 4pp above the 46% threshold - already in favorable territory for YES resolution
Large forecaster base (866) creates sticky predictions resistant to rapid movement
Short time horizon (~9 days) limits opportunity for large shifts without news catalyst
Recent trend upward (46%→50% in 2 days) suggests bullish forecaster sentiment
Manifold at 36% (14pp lower) suggests Metaculus may be overestimating - potential for correction
Billboard actively blocking AI songs from Hot 100 could discourage forecasters if more stories emerge
